page.title: 05THE CLIFFS
page.content: Cliffs mark the Northern edge of St.Andrews from the Golf Links eastwards to the Castle and beyond. They are made of sandstone with layers of shale. At present the sea is undercutting them and there was a substantial rock fall two years ago about 300 yards East of the Step Rock Pool. The cost of protecting them from further erosion is very high and Fife Regional Council has so far declined to accept financial responsibility for this. Geological study suggests that after further erosion of about 10 yards the cliffs should stabilize naturally and that the houses on the cliff top are in no immediate danger. There is a cave, accessible at low tide, called the Piper's Cave which is said to haunted by a phantom piper.
